text:
- Hearst has over 20,000
employees worldwide,
and a large number of businesses.

Traditionally, it's
known for its newspapers,
magazines, television stations.

In the last few years, Hearst
has diversified quite a bit.

AWS Skills Guild really
helped us bring together

all of our different businesses
into one trading initiative.

The program really allows us
to think strategically about,
you know, where technology is moving
and how we can upskill our employees
to be prepared for that.

Working with AWS Skills
Guild has really helped us

create a brand and really a
personality for Tech Academy.
In the last year, Tech Academy programming

has been able to impact
almost 3,000 individuals.

- My name's Derek Ferguson,
I'm the Chief Software Officer
for the Fitch Group, a Hearst company.
The AWS Skills Guild allowed us

to give all of our employees
a certain base foundation
in the same skills.

Because of the training
that our resources received,

we can now build some solutions
for just 10% of the cost
that it would've taken us to build
and operate those solutions previously.

It's good to know that as new
technologies become available,
it's not something that our employees

have to pick up one at
a time on their own.

This training has allowed
us to streamline the path

of that data, has
benefited the end customer.

We really have a need to
stay on the cutting edge

and create products that our
customers find compelling
and engaging.

This is a program that I
think adds tremendous value.
- The AWS trainings and certification

has really helped our
team to think bigger,
to collaborate, and to spark innovation.
It's been really great to see the team

going into these trainings
and the learnings

and the takeaways that
they've had as part of it.
The Data Platform team

and the current state
has logging processes
that were very manual and time consuming.
Part of the training,
they were able to streamline their logging

and monitoring processes
based on what they learned.
